name: 羅元隆
objective: This course is designed as the precursor course selected by seniors and graduate students. It covers the basic knowledge of the atmospheric boundary layer, bluff-body aerodynamics, aero-elasticity, the wind-resistant design of buildings, and the concept of wind-resistant design of bridges. National and international wind codes for buildings and bridges are introduced with practices based on wind tunnel test data. Other related wind issues are also conceptually introduced in this course.

W03/Review of Dynamics of Structures II
W04/Atmospheric Boundary Layer
W05/Basic Design Wind Speed
W06/Bluff-Body Aerodynamics
W07/Review of Spectral Analysis I
W08/Review of Spectral Analysis II
W09/Mid-term Exam (Written Test)
W10/Wind Tunnel Visiting (Tamkang University)
W11/Wind-Resistant Design of Tall Buildings I
W12/Wind-Resistant Design of Tall Buildings II
W13/Wind-Resistant Design of Tall Buildings III
W14/Wind-Resistant Design of Tall Buildings IV
W15/Wind-Resistant Design of Bridges I
W16/Wind-Resistant Design of Bridges II
W17/Other Wind-related Issues
W18/Final Exam (Final Report Submission)
